title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (https://www.contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available https://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/.

what: Quick instructions for AI coding agents working on ggsegHO
title: Quick instructions for AI coding agents working on ggsegHO
text: ggseg 2.0 atlas package providing brain atlas data ggseg ecosystem. data-package custom functions.

title: Quick instructions for AI coding agents working on ggsegHO
text: data/*.rda — Unified ggseg_atlas objects (2D-atlas) R/data.R — Roxygen2 documentation atlas R/ggsegHO-package.R — Package-level docs, imports ggseg.formats R/sysdata.rda — Internal palette data (brain_pals) data-raw/ — Scripts generated/converted atlas data

title: Quick instructions for AI coding agents working on ggsegHO
text: package depends ggseg.formats provides ggseg_atlas class. atlas objects work ggseg::geom_brain() (2D).

title: Quick instructions for AI coding agents working on ggsegHO
text: Update docs: devtools::document() Run tests: devtools::test() (testthat edition 3, describe/style) Full check: devtools::check() Build pkgdown site: pkgdown::build_site()

title: Quick instructions for AI coding agents working on ggsegHO
text: code comments except necessary workarounds Roxygen2 markdown enabled Tests use describe/BDD style vdiffr visual regression NEWS.md tracks user-facing changes (CI/pkgdown changes) URLs point ggseg GitHub org (LCBC-UiO)

what: Harvard-Oxford Atlas for the ggseg Ecosystem
title: Harvard-Oxford Atlas for the ggseg Ecosystem
text: package contains dataset plotting Harvard-Oxford cortical atlas ggseg ggseg3d. Makris,et al. (2006) Schizophrenia research 83(2-3):155-151 pubmed

title: Harvard-Oxford Atlas for the ggseg Ecosystem
text: recommend installing ggseg-atlases ggseg r-universe: can install released version ggsegHO GitHub :
code: # Enable this universe options(repos = c(     ggseg = 'https://ggseg.r-universe.dev',     CRAN = 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))  # Install some packages install.packages('ggsegHO') # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("LCBC-UiO/ggsegHO")

title: Harvard-Oxford Atlas for the ggseg Ecosystem
text: basic example shows solve common problem:  Please note ‘ggsegHO’ project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.
code: library(ggsegHO) library(ggseg) #> Warning: package 'ggseg' was built under R version 4.1.1 #> Loading required package: ggplot2 library(ggplot2)  plot(hoCort) +   theme(legend.position = "bottom",         legend.text = element_text(size = 6)) +   guides(fill = guide_legend(ncol = 3))

what: ggsegHO: Harvard-Oxford Atlas for the 'ggseg' Ecosystem — ggsegHO-package
title: ggsegHO: Harvard-Oxford Atlas for the 'ggseg' Ecosystem — ggsegHO-package
text: Harvard-Oxford cortical atlas 'ggseg' ecosystem. Provides unified 'ggseg_atlas' object 2D polygon geometry use 'ggseg'.

title: ggsegHO: Harvard-Oxford Atlas for the 'ggseg' Ecosystem — ggsegHO-package
text: Maintainer: Athanasia Mo Mowinckel .m.mowinckel@psykologi.uio.(ORCID) Authors: Didac Vidal-Pineiro d.v.pineiro@psykologi.uio.(ORCID)

title: Harvard-Oxford Cortical Atlas — hoCort
text: Brain atlas Harvard-Oxford cortical parcellation 48 regions per hemisphere. Contains 2D polygon geometry ggseg::geom_brain().

title: Harvard-Oxford Cortical Atlas — hoCort
text: ggseg.formats::ggseg_atlas object (cortical).

title: Harvard-Oxford Cortical Atlas — hoCort
text: Makris, et al. (2006) Schizophrenia research 83(2-3):155-151 (doi:10.1016/j.schres.2005.11.020 )

title: Harvard-Oxford Cortical Atlas — hoCort
code: hoCort() #>  #> ── hoCort ggseg atlas ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Type: cortical #> Regions: 48 #> Hemispheres: left, right #> Views: lateral, medial #> Palette: ✔ #> Rendering: ✔ ggseg #> ✖ ggseg3d (none) #> ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> # A tibble: 98 × 3 #>    hemi  region                                 label                            #>    <chr> <chr>                                  <chr>                            #>  1 left  "Angular Gyrus"                        lh_Angular.Gyrus                 #>  2 left  "Central Opercular Cortex"             lh_Central.Opercular.Cortex      #>  3 left  "Frontal Operculum Cortex"             lh_Frontal.Operculum.Cortex      #>  4 left  "Frontal Orbital Cortex"               lh_Frontal.Orbital.Cortex        #>  5 left  "Frontal Pole"                         lh_Frontal.Pole                  #>  6 left  "Heschl s Gyrus includes H1 and H2 "   lh_Heschl.s.Gyrus..includes.H1.… #>  7 left  "Inf. title: ggsegHO 2.0.0
text: hoCort now ggseg_atlas object (ggseg.formats) containing 2D data. 2D-atlas (3D mesh data available). Use ggplot() + ggseg::geom_brain(atlas = hoCort) 2D plots. ggseg.formats now hard dependency (Depends). Package URLs updated LCBC-UiO ggseg GitHub organisation.

title: ggsegHO 1.0.02
text: updated atlases work ggseg >= 1.6.0

title: ggsegHO 1.0.01
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
